caption: Excellent service and amazing food

This place is great! I am definitely not a Brooklyn Winery but they actually took the time to show me all the different options I have. I also did the cheese and wine taste testing and it was Brooklyn Winery.

We were in NY for a wedding and were referred to his place for an evening out. While not fancy, it is the kind of place to go to for fun and good drinks. We went with a group and we all had fun and didn't feel rushed. It's a bit loud but that is to be expected.
I come here quite often for events and even for lunch. But this time was so different it made me really appreciate the staff a lot more. I will be back many many times!

I popped in here solely for the wine, so I can’t comment on the restaurant portion. But as for the wine, it’s excellent. I bought a Malbec (yet to try) and a blend (which was very good). To order, you just walk in and go to the bar. The bartender was very helpful in recommending me wines that would fit what I wanted. I’ll definitely be back, and I’m thrilled to support a local vintner.

We love this place!! Reservations were made to celebrate my husbands birthday and let me just say  that the service, food and especially the Wine was amazing! The staff were all really nice and accommodating. The food was really good and most of all tasteful! Their wine, especially their Merlot and Riesling is really good. Our waiter was knowledgeable in food to wine pairings. I highly recommend for birthdays, gatherings or just date night! Thank you Brooklyn Winery for an amazing Saturday night!

I reserved a table in one of their tasting bays (for free!) to celebrate a birthday and just had friends open their own tabs. The contract says there's a one drink per person minimum, but I didn't feel as though it was strictly regulated and it definitely wasn't hard for our party to meet that. :)
Great service, and wonderful ambiance
Had the day off and decided to go local wine tasting.  This is the 2nd time I've been.  They seem to update something every time we go, which is cool.
Always love coming to the winery.  Always amazing wine and delicious food. Great service and atmosphere!

I've been there many times as a customer - for happy hours, and it has been my go to place for drinks and eats with friends in Alameda. Some of my favs are their sparkling wines like Blanc De Blanc & Sparkling Zinfandel.

I have been a patron of Rock Wall for about two years now. My husband and I would stop in for a glass or two every now and then and love the ambiance, delicious wine, and outdoor seating especially on a sunny day.
When I think industrial location + winery/alcohol, I usually think "uh oh, another hipster establishment" but THANKFULLY, Rock Wall is anything but that!
Nice wine and cheese board.
Excellent food, wine and service! Get the Brussels sprouts! Street side outdoor seating had great ambiance!
Nice outdoor seating and wine flight options! Good service as well.
Okay service. Decent food. Good portions.  Fair prices.. Nice wait staff

My girlfriend and I went here for drinks & dinner and got a tour of the winery. Great service and wonderful food! The staff was knowledgeable of my girlfriends allergies as well. Just a great place to go!
The ambiance is breathtaking
Very cool atmosphere food music and service. Highly recommended
Nice place with food parking is difficult.

We knew we wanted to get married in Brooklyn and we wanted it to be a reflection of us as a couple. From the minute we toured the Winery I knew it was the place we were going to get married. Emily and her amazing team made the process as easy as possible. The Winery itself is the perfect canvas for a romantic feel. The glow of the ceremony/dining room is what dreams are made of. The food was amazing and I loved that it was family style, everyone ate so much and loved our dinner. I loved that there was so much included in booking the space (candles, candle holders, day of event manager, food + dessert, the beautiful eclectic plates & silverware, alcohol). Because the Winery is so beautiful, if you want, you can cut back on flowers (which we didn't) and lighting (which we also didn't). But you could if you wanted to save a little extra and not get those things! The Brooklyn Winery completed the whole vision we had for our wedding. I wouldn't have changed a thing! I'll be forever grateful to Emily & the amazing team!
Completely rebuilt after Sandy. Excellent story. Excellent wine.
The staff was pleasant and courteous. I love the place for parties. One draw back was the music was extremely loud. We spend the time yelling at each other.
This place is amazing, it makes a wedding location spot. Thinking about having my reception here, the folks that run this place are great too.

We have just held a rehearsal dinner, and wedding drinks receptionat the Brooklyn Winery, and cannot praise this place more highly. Caroline is incredible. She made the planning so easy, and was really helpful, professional and flexible. All of the staff there are amazing, including Emily and Nicole, the bar tender and wait staff. The space looked beautiful and the food was delicious. We chose the Miso salmon, fried chicken, smashed potatoes and seasonal vegetables, all excellent. We used the suggested vendors for lighting sound and flowers, Mark and Gabrielle, who were excellent too. Our guests were raving about the Brooklyn Winery all night, and we were delighted. Thank you Brooklyn Winery!
One of a kind place in Brooklyn but ... not real food , expensive and most important none of their wines is good enough to be remember . Service not the best

Came here for an anniversary party. It was beautiful, the food better than I expected and the wine literally left me wishing I had discovered this place sooner. The Chardonnay was very nice, crisp, citrus forward, not buttery. But the Zin knocked it out of the park. Haven’t had one that good, made by a winery on the east coast. Fantastic!!

The wine is great, and when you can get in it's even better, but they have random events which means the place isn't open to the public. They also have this absolutely amazing habit of never answering their phone when you try to call ahead to make sure you can buy a few bottles as opposed to driving 90 mins in traffic to just get stuck outside... 11 attempts to call in as many days and no one ever answers.
love the atmosphere, wine selections and staff

Brooklyn Winery was the absolute perfect wedding venue for us! Their attention to detail was impeccable and we had the most beautiful and smooth night. Our guests keep raving about how amazing the ambiance, food, service and general demeanor of all of the employees was. Emily was our day or coordinator and she is truly a gem. So approachable and always reachable. And very calm and sweet. Truly could not imagine having held our wedding elsewhere!
Such a beautiful place! Amazing hospitality, and a premium selection of different wines.
Very unfriendly/rude staff. Terrible service, extremely slow and very inpatient! Deffinatly not worth the  price.

Beautiful venue and friendly staff, but the sound system was terrible. I could not hear the speeches of the wedding party or the officiant clearly. Other than that, the place was beautiful and lovely. The food was awesome!
A fun, low-key place with a nice ambiance and great happy hour wines

All that’s needed to say about Brooklyn Winery is that it’s perfect. The wedding planning process was so much easier than it would have been anywhere else. The venue and atmosphere was amazing. The food was unbelievable. The staff leading up to and during the wedding was so helpful. Everything about our wedding was perfect and we felt like we didn’t even need to make that many decisions because BW is so good at what they do. We had 155 guests at the wedding and all of them kept complimenting the staff, venue, and food. Can't recommend the Winery enough!
Went there for the first time last night and loved every minute! Fabulous and knowledgeable staff made it a memorable evening, we took some wine to go too! We’ll definitely be regulars
Beautiful atmosphere inside! Great little spot tucked away in Brooklyn.

Love this place. They throw a truly unique and memorable New Year’s Eve, and the wine tastings are always fun. Staff is friendly and knowledgeable and food is delicious. EDIT: Today picked up my case of fortitude (fortified wine), which is to die for, and had a lovely dinner of grilled shrimp and a cheese plate. This place keeps on giving!
What a fabulous experience. Everybody was stellar. Compliments to the chef.
Brooklyn Winery is a great low-key spot for a glass of wine and a meal in a classy rustic atmosphere. The wine is pretty good and the food is pretty great.
Amazing food and wine.

Wine is made here in a large back warehouse you can see from the inner rooms. This is a bar some nights but specializes in parties and weddings. The space is quite flexible and configurable, with a greenhouse roof in one section that can be used as a meeting/classroom/ceremony space and then covered into a dining area. Even without loud music it gets pretty loud inside.  The staff is great. The wine is good, very American style.
(Translated by Google) Urban winery. A little higher.  (Original) アーバンワイナリー。少し高め。

We got married here almost two years ago and people still tell me how beautiful the venue was. The wine was amazing, and the staff are incredibly helpful. The whole experience, from the food to the day of wedding coordinator, is perfect. I can't recommend this place enough.  Also, the food and wine are great otherwise, too!
Expensive and the wine is ok. Great ambiance.
👍🏼💙 this place. 🍷🍾
I usually like red wine but this place's white wine is really good! The tour was very good, too. About 25 dollars is worth it!
My wife and I had a wonderful time at the Brooklyn Winery. everything was amazing and the food was out of this world. staff was amazing
Loved our wine tasting! Purchased a few of my favorites afterwards.
I went with my girlfriend and another couple to their NYE party and it was excellent. Great food, amazing wine and top shelf liquor, all in a relaxed and not overly crowded place.
Great find. Great staff.

Our wedding was perfect - and I don't prescribe to hyperbole. Where to start? With a thank you to the BK Winery team. As I said in my toast, you all were so integral in making our day so meaningful. From the planning process to being a friendly face when we stopped by for a bite to eat, everyone was so incredibly professional and the day ran so smoothly I cannot begin to express what a relief and pleasure it was to choose the Brooklyn Winery as our wedding venue. They were brilliant. It's clear they are family there, and Emily loves her job as the wedding planner. What started as a few boxes of decorations and vendor contracts turned into a magical space that was both completely "us" and also definitely the winery's eclectic vibe. We loved every part of the experience and will happily throw future events there (if you aren't booked up!). Oh. And we should probably talk about their dinner service as well - it was regarded as the best food people have had at a wedding, I take that as no small feat. And their wine is so very good. You've upped the wedding game to a new level BK Winery - thank you thank you thank you.
Good wine
Great wine! OK food/value, very laid back service.
Great selection of wines, cozy vibe, very good service.
Amazing wine. Loads of veggie options. Laid back while still being elegant. Great staff, tours, weekly specials
Well designed and decent wine selection, a bit on the pricey side.
Nice space
Good food great atmosphere. Wonderful venue for an affair.
Cool spot, nice ambiance and lots of space bit a bit to loud
nice
Place was awesome, we are coming back soon.

I came back early January on a mid-day double date - and was so blown away vs my previous visit.  Our waitress suggested we hop on the winery tour that was about to start, kept an eye on our jackets, and brought us our wine to the back room so we could sip & learn.  Noel, the tour guide, was outstanding - the kind of person you want to be friends with, and my husband, who rarely comments on other women in front of me said "that chick is awesome".   A very fun afternoon jaunt followed by more wine and snacks.  The menu is much more streamlined than it used to be.  Loved my Old Vine Zinfandel on a cold day.  Looking forward to coming back for the suggested addition of bubbles to a Rose.

Chill...they have unoaked chardonnay which I liked. Pours could be heavier at $10 a glass but it's new York. We did have some light bites which were good has a warehouse vibe, open, clean, not tight like a lot of places.

I was shopping around venues when I got engaged, I wanted something simple and intimate. When my boss asked me to host our company holiday party I thought what better way to get the whole experience??? this was the perfect opportunity. The venue is warm, inviting and intimate. Somewhat seductive with the flicker of the candles illuminating each room, the rustic décor which was in good taste and most importantly the wine. Everyone left that night feeling really good such an amazing atmosphere. I received so many compliments which I took credit for but ever so grateful for The Brooklyn Winery Staff who played a good part in this event. They were so welcoming, the food very, very tasteful. Kara, Jessica and Sean were on top of everything and really helped out with suggestions, food choices and entertainment. This is a beautiful venue and I would recommend anyone to stop by for a glass of wine, a tour of the winery or host a party. And I will most certainly plan my simple Brooklyn Wedding in this beautiful Brooklyn Winery.

A great find! Amazing food, drinks and staff.  My sister had her wedding at the Brooklyn winery and it was very special. Buttlered appetizers were fantastic especially the pan seared salmon with wasabi carmel sauce.
Brussel sprout nirvana
come on great music, nice staff!!
What a wonderful and unique restaurant/event space.  The food was excellent, desserts were even better. I would have any party that i were hosting, there!
Good
Definitely recommend hosting events here. The weddings I have shot here have had top notch staff from start to finish.
A very nice place to have fun with firends and enjoy some drinks. This is a must go place

The look, feel, smell, flavors, colors, sounds, staff, EVERYTHING! Came here for a date and this location is perfect for it, if you enjoy wine that is. I'm no wine snob, but I definitely enjoy wine every so often.  We both got a flight of three choices each for $30 total, which in it of itself is a great deal. The issue is I can't tell you the difference between styles of wine. Thankfully for us we had an amazing server who worked with both of us to select the right wines. When we got them, I couldn't have been happier.  This is an enjoyable play to try wines, eat food, and enjoy the company of friends.

My husband and I had out wedding here in August 2013. It was everything we wanted and more. We constantly return and always suggest friends who visit from over seas to make this a stopping point - epically for the Resiling!
Great atmosphere, wine and light snacks.

Nailed it!  We are so very grateful and appreciative for all you and Brooklyn Winery did to make our Engagement party exceptional.  The Staff is so professional, attentive and really nice people!  The Atrium Room was so beautiful and the food was truly plentiful and fantastic.  The food in the buffet area was artfully displayed and set off beautifully with candle light. The passed hors d'oeuvres were excellent, just as you stated they would be.  I can not tell you how pleased we were and it was a wonderful party, thanks to you and all your crew at BW.  Would highly recommend!
Booked a winery tour and tasting. The people were very friendly and informative. They make wine making look easy. Left with two bottles. Great place i would suggest it to anybody.

nice setup, good wine selection. for those who don't know what they like, they provide excellent recommendations to suit your tastes. love the layout with the long tables and wooden benches. music wasn't too loud either.

I've been here twice and still have yet to have a bad time. This place is great for an event or just to grab some wine. They also do a lot of events for the winery itself. The wine is great as is the food and it's great for a date or a get together with girlfriends.

I had bought two spots to the wine tour they were offering for a friend's birthday. At first, we weren't sure what to expect since the place looked a bit small.  You know the saying, "Small things big personality?" well it applies to here [in a good way]. It was super easy to make a reservation for the tour and when we arrived 30 minutes early,  the hostess was very friendly. She gave us our tickets which we could redeem for a cheese or meat plate or a glass of wine. My friend got a glass of wine while we waited.  Before the tour took place, they took us up to a small room where they gave us each our own wine glass with the "Brooklyn Winery" engraved in it [you get to keep it]. We got to taste a bit of white wine while we waited for the tour to begin.  Although, since my friend already had a glass, she double fisting her wine of glass with samples.  Before the tour began, they allowed us to leave our stuff in a locked room where we would be visiting again to have more flights.  The tour itself was very short, there was only two rooms in which we walked through but the tastings they gave had a very generous pour.  The tour guide was very friendly and tried hard at being funny but I guess we were a tough crowd because no one really laughed. I believe we had roughly 12 tastings. I couldn't remember I got  completely wasted after the 2nd flight and kept giggling [I don't really drink at all]. My friend on the other managed to finish all of my tastings and hers and she ordered more wine during dinner. Overall,  the tour was very fun and informative and definitely worth the money if you are oenophile.  After the tour was finished, they did lead you downstairs where you could redeem your ticket or you can enjoy a causal dinner with drinks.  We got the cheese plate and it was a good size serving and buttermilk chicken bites, which was a bit smaller but just as delicious as the cheese plate. If you are going for drinks, I would definitely recommend the cheese plate. It was really good.  I would recommend signing up for their loyalty card because you earn points when you buy food, drinks and bottles of wine for free stuff.

Great cozy space. Awesome for first dates and nights out to catch up with friends. tons of space and the fact that they have a great selection of wines is a given. Food selections are great for sharing and they even have space for events. Check the calendar and check out Wino Bingo if you can....

A delicious array of wines; I really love the stainless steel aged riesling. This winery gave me my first sip of orange wine which was definitely an interesting experience. The free tour was short, but really nice.

My job had a retreat that involved going to this winery. They set up a very nice wine and games night for us in their back room. We got to drink different whites and reds, and had some meat and cheese plates.  They had wine/brooklyn trivia games and we broke in to teams to play them and afterwards we were served a delicious dinner with two entree options and two sides served up family style.  Our main host was very friendly and me and my co workers had a great time here. I would highly recommend this place for corporate events.
I have been going here since 2011 summer.  Love the wine that changes so often; love the menu that changes every season! and ambiance is fantastic!

I have a soft spot for this place because I had the opportunity to tour it before it was fully open. I like places that open the doors to future customers and give a sneak peak into the business. I have been a few time after the open and if I had the money, I would totally purchase a barrel to make my own wine. They also have a rooftop that I am planning to visit during the summer. Great place!
I can't rate this place high enough.  The the decor draws you in, and the wine keeps you there. Great place to stop in or to hang out for a while.
Great wine, intelligent staff, and awesome decor.  With great weekend events
Over priced for sure
Beautiful environment with low lighting and a variety of woods. Cozy feel and comfortable atmosphere. Friendly and knowledgeable staff.
perfect for a nice night out or special occassion
nice ambiance and cool place to grab a drink during the afternoon.

Went there for an event. The space is great. The front was open to the sidewalk. It's close to the action, but not in it, so you have space to move. They currently make 8 wines in house. The staff were awesome. Friendly and knowledgeable. I will be going back for sure. Good place for dates and events.

Awesome Brooklyn spot! The wine is made here in Brooklyn and is absolutely amazing. Great atmosphere and a fun place to meet up with friends.  I met up with a bunch of friends from boarding school here and it was the perfect spot- relaxed, fun, and something a little out of the ordinary! Try their Chardonnay-it was absolutely spectacular. Can't wait to come back.

Great little winery in Williamsburg with a party room in the back for small to medium receptions and events.  Staff is very informative, approachable, and friendly.  I am from Manhattan and would totally come back with the gf or other fun function.
A vast wine bar – get a table upstairs for more privacy, or outside when it’s nice. Try one of their flights of wine and definitely pair it with their Bar Snacks!
Had the most wonderful evenings while visiting Williamsburg, including a tasting of their own wine and delish food! Thanks to Clark and John!
Great selection of wines, great atmosphere but s bit loud but what place isn't nowadays.
A bit pricey, small portions, slow service.

What a gorgeous space! Williamsburg is starting to have everything including their very own wine cellar. Brooklyn Winery hosts tours and you can make your own wine. I attended for a private party and it was a blast. Very nice staff and a lot of little rooms within. It's warm and cozy.
